rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0001
rows.name:
Hey, Gramps... You were protecting
this place for years and years, right?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0002
rows.name:
That I was.
Five hundred of them, in fact.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0003
rows.name:
But all that time I was a kid in Iyasaki,
I never noticed you doing anything
like that.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0004
rows.name:
Well, things have been quiet for the
past few centuries.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0005
rows.name:
Given two hundred years or so,
rumors pass into legend, and people
stop taking them so seriously.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0006
rows.name:
Long ago, Drivers used to enter this
place quite often, but their numbers
have long since fallen off.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0007
rows.name:
Besides, the entrance itself will not
open for any but a Liberalitan.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0008
rows.name:
And sad though it may be, the
population of Iyasaki is on the decline.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0009
rows.name:
Fewer and fewer people are even
aware of this place.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0010
rows.name: I see...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0011
rows.name:
So you actually had work to do
back in the day, huh?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0012
rows.name:
I'm no layabout now, either!
I was the one who told you of
this place, if you recall!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0013
rows.name: Sure, whatevs.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0014
rows.name:
Honestly, Nia, you're just like Correl
when she was younger.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0015
rows.name: Huh?! Really?!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0016
rows.name: I'm not sure if that's a compliment...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0017
rows.name:
She was quite the little firecracker.
Even came in here once, as a child.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0018
rows.name: Wow, pretty gutsy.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0019
rows.name:
Though she turned back upon reaching
the bridge. She must have sensed that
this was a place to be feared.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0020
rows.name:
It's protected by the village's guardian
spirit after all. Anyone in Iyasaki would
know it's not a place to enter lightly.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0021
rows.name:
To fear and to respect are two sides
of the same coin, you know.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0022
rows.name:
The people of Iyasaki understand
the importance of this place on an
instinctive level.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0023
rows.name: What do I say to that?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0024
rows.name: Only thanks to you, Gramps.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0025
rows.name: How would outsiders feel about it?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0101
rows.name:
You've been protecting this place
for centuries, right?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0102
rows.name:
I think it's probably thanks to you
that the villagers have such a powerful
respect for the Village Guardian.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0103
rows.name:
Yeah, you can't have respect without
someone to keep it alive.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0104
rows.name:
If it were not for the Divine Beast Seiryuu,
this place may truly have been
forgotten by the world completely.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0105
rows.name:
Well, I don't think anyone's put
it to me quite like that before.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0106
rows.name:
You've done good,
these past 500 years.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0107
rows.name: Yeah. Good job, Gramps.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0109
rows.name:
More than anything,
at times like this...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0110
rows.name:
I just feel thankful that I'm able to
travel with you all in this form.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0111
rows.name:
If I'd remained in my old body,
I might never have come here
and heard those words!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0112
rows.name:
I thought you were gonna say
something profound, not just
bask in the praise!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0113
rows.name: Hohohoh!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0201
rows.name: People from outside of Iyasaki village?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0202
rows.name:
None have entered in recent years, but
400 years ago, visitors did sometimes
venture in here with Iyasaki youths.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0203
rows.name:
It seems people from outside see
this place as little more than another
ruin to be explored.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0204
rows.name:
I tried to talk them out of entering,
but they never appreciated my words.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0205
rows.name:
Still, I didn't feel it was right to
stop them by force.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0206
rows.name:
They stood precious little chance of
reaching the end, at any rate.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0207
rows.name:
Thus it was that many adventurers
entered, never to return.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0208
rows.name:
I daresay their sacrifice also
contributed to the healthy respect
the villagers now hold for this place.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0209
rows.name:
Yeah, you don't treat a ruin lightly
when folks go in and never come out.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0210
rows.name:
I don't doubt that that is indeed
a part of it.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0211
rows.name:
You've been watching for 500 years
as all this stuff happened, right?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0212
rows.name: I guess that must've been tough going.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0213
rows.name:
Sorry for being all disrespectful
and stuff before.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0214
rows.name: No need to apologize, Nia.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0215
rows.name:
We are all quite used to your
foul mouth at this point.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0216
rows.name:
And we know you have a
kind heart underneath.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0217
rows.name: Urghh...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0218
rows.name:
I wanna make a snappy comeback,
but that would ruin my apology!
